intro: Adenostemma cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
